job_title: Human Resources Manager in Kansas City, MO
pros: Supportive Work environment and flexible work schedules, just a great culture and good people doing amazing things for others.
cons: None, I am very happy here.

job_title: LPN- Private Duty in Kansas City, MO

Approachable management & Medical Staff
Great night and weekend differential.
Good benefits for a single person

Lots of turn over lately.
Low starting salary
Expensive family benefits

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Kansas City, MO
pros: It's a fulfilling position to be in.

job_title: Hospice RN Case Manager in Kansas City, MO

job_title: Admit Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great Co-workers. Involved Management. Respected in the Community. Excellent Doctors.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: It's a great feeling to know that you helped someone and their family in the transition from life to death. A lot of people don't really understand what is going on within themselves and we help with this process. The clinical coordinator tries to schedule everyone fairly. Benefits are okay, but, I've had better.
cons: The hardest part of working here is that it's so political. The nurse manager has picks of who she will and will not discipline, while, some employees are picked on without reprimand of the perpetrator just because they are different. For example, your hair or you may be nerdy (exceptionally smart), very quiet with your personal business and even if you refuse help. The charge nurses are expected to be the knowledgeable ones and if you display more knowledge than they do, then, you're set up to make a mistake. I find that I have to always be looking over my shoulder and triple checking that I have done everything.

pros: Dedicated clinicians with hearts of gold and a few excellent managers, as you'd find in any hospice.
cons: Kansas City Hospice used to be an excellent place ro work.  However, with recent changes in management the culture has become toxic and cronyized.  Expect average salary, very high caseloads, and a company run on panic.

pros: None. Nothing. Treat you like you are lucky to be there even though the working environment is dangerous.
cons: No paid holidays. Use PTO or go unpaid building has black mold. Fights are common and no one gets fired only suspended. Scary work environment

job_title: Social Worker, MSW in Kansas City, MO
pros: Love working with the terminally ill and making a difference in their lives
cons: Little recognition for efforts, looked down upon by many of the nurses (those who think "I can do the job of the MSW, why are they here?), low pay

job_title: RN Case Manager in Kansas City, MO
pros: Hands on with patients in their homes,  flexible schedule,  friendly team to work with.
cons: More charting and paperwork than I ever dreamed of,  but this just comes with the territory.

job_title: Data Management in Kansas City, MO
pros: Loved this company very much! Sweet sweet folks to work for.
cons: Not very much growth opportunities unless your in the medical field or have a medical degree.

job_title: Account Representative in Kansas City, MO
pros: Helps dying patients and there are some very caring nurses.
cons: Management, especially the CEO are a closed-minded group who only thing of themselves and their own interests.  They have been there for so long that they have forgotten their mission.  And new management just follows CEO's orders.
